contextId.information: "given him safety from all his surrounding enemies." Here "rest" is an abstract noun. AT: "caused the enemy people groups to stop attacking Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: given him rest from all his surrounding enemies

contextId.information: The word "faithfulness" is an abstract noun that can be stated as "faithful." Also this statement can be translated in positive form. AT: "But I will always remain faithful to him, unlike I was to Saul" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: But my covenant faithfulness will not leave him, as I took it from Saul

contextId.information: The word "siege" can be expressed with the verbs "surround" and "attack." AT: "his army surround and attack the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "this great evil" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "It would be very evil to make me leave! It would be even worse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Because this great evil of making me leave is even worse

contextId.information: The noun "slaughter" means an event where many people are brutally killed. This can be expressed as a verb. AT: "Many of the soldiers who follow Absalom have been slaughtered" or "The enemy soldiers have killed many of the soldiers who follow Absalom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: A slaughter has taken place among the soldiers who follow Absalom

contextId.information: The word "rejection" can be expressed with the verb "reject." AT: "for the men of Israel to reject Ahithophel's good advice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: the rejection of Ahithophel's good advice

contextId.information: The word "falsehood" can be expressed with a verb phrase. Also, this refers to disobeying the king's command. This can be stated clearly. AT: "doing something that is wrong" or "by disobeying the king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
